body.description: Get Amplified with the ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 30 Series based on the NVIDIA Ampere architecture. Built with enhanced RT Core and Tensor Cores, new streaming multiprocessors, and high-speed GDDR6 memory, the ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 3060 Twin Edge OC gives rise to amplified gaming with high fidelity. FEATURES: GDDR6 Graphics Memory, 2nd Gen Ray Tracing Cores, 3rd Gen Tensor Cores, VR Ready, IceStorm 2.0 Advanced Cooling, Active Fan Control with Freeze Fan Stop, Metal Backplate, NVIDIA DLSS, NVIDIA G-SYNC compatible. SPECIFICATIONS: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 GPU, 3584 CUDA cores, 12GB GDDR6 memory, 192-bit memory bus, Engine boost clock: 1807 MHz, Memory clock: 15.0 Gbps, PCI Express 4.0 16x. SOFTWARE COMPATIBILITY: Game Ready Drivers and NVIDIA Studio Drivers, Microsoft DirectX 12 Ultimate, Vulkan RT API, OpenGL 4.6, Windows 10 64-bit (build 2004 or later). CONNECTIONS: 3 x DisplayPort 1.4a (up to 7680x4320@60Hz), 1 x HDMI 2.1 (up to 7680x4320@60Hz), HDCP 2.3 support, Quad simultaneous display capable. POWER REQUIREMENTS: 600-watt power supply recommended, 170-watt max power consumption, 8-pin power connector. INSIDE THE BOX: ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 3060 Twin Edge OC, user manual. DIMENSIONS: Length: 224.1mm (8.8in), Height: 116.3mm (4.6in), Width: Dual slot (39.2mm) (1.5in) BOX: Height: 283mm (11.1in), Width: 218mm (8.6in), Depth: 83mm (3.3in).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 3060 Twin Edge OC Get Amplified with the ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 30 Series based on the NVIDIA Ampere architecture. Built with enhanced RT Cores and Tensor Cores, new streaming multiprocessors, and high-speed GDDR6 memory, the ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 3060 Twin Edge OC gives rise to amplified gaming with high fidelity.

NVIDIA AMPERE ARCHITECTURE 2ND GENERATION RT CORES - 2X Throughput 3rd GENERATION TENSOR CORES - Up to 2X Throughput NEW SM - 2X FP32 Throughput RAY TRACING Ray tracing is the holy grail of gaming graphics, simulating the physical behavior of light to bring real-time, cinematic-quality rendering to even the most visually intense games. MAX FPS. MAX QUALITY. POWERED BY AI. NVIDIA DLSS is groundbreaking AI rendering that boosts frame rates with uncompromising image quality using the dedicated AI processing Tensor cores on GeForce RTX. This gives you the performance headroom to crank up settings and resolutions for an incredible visual experience. The AI revolution has arrived to gaming.

Advanced Cooling - A more refined IceStorm 2.0 cooling system is purpose-built for wider coverage to keep the GPU cooler and running stronger 11-BLADE FAN The all-new 11-blade fan increases airflow by up to 10% (when compared to the previous generation design) ACTIVE FAN CONTROL Let users have more control over the fans when using the ZOTAC GAMING FireStorm software. Adjust fan rotations independently and apply increased airflow only to where and when it’s needed. FREEZE FAN STOP Automatically enables efficient and quieter cooling by stopping the fans when the GPU is idle, whilst reducing wear and tear on the fan system.

Advanced Cooling - A more refined IceStorm 2.0 cooling system is purpose-built for wider coverage to keep the GPU cooler and running stronger WIDE ARRAY ALUMINIUM HEATSINK Wide aluminum fin-stack array heatsink paired with copper heat pipes extract more heat and distribute it more efficiently. NEW & IMPROVED HEAT PIPE LAYOUT A new and improved heat pipe layout increases direct GPU contact in a more densely packed space. MORE RESILIENT The design underlines durability with a metal backplate to increase the overall card rigidity.

TAKE CONTROL With a simple and intuitive minimal interface, the ZOTAC GAMING FireStorm Utility provides simple tools to transform fine-tuning your GPU into a simple task. Monitor your GPU, control the fan speed, and many more options.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Zotac 12GB 3060 Graphics Card
reviews.reviewText: Had and old 480GT 4GB card that couldn't keep up with the new computer I built. Built an I5 12600KF on an MSI Z790 motherboard, 32GB DDR 5 memory, 512GB Windows11 OS SSD, 2 TB hard drive, and a 2TBNVMe SSD. Thought i would use the old card until I could find a card that I liked but that just didn't work out! The old card just refused to even display the games I was trying to run. Bought the Zotac first, because it would ship from Amazon faster by about 2 weeks that the cheaper MSI 3060 I was initially looking at would. It cost me an additional $60 dollars but I didn't want to have to wait 2 weeks for it! Second, I watched some reviews on the Zotac 3060 on YouTube and the performance numbers were better by about 6 to 8 percent. I installed the card when it arrived and installation was a breeze. Booted up the card, went to their website and installed the software, also easy. Rebooted the machine and the card performs flawlessly!! The card will run older games like Diablo 3 in all high and ultra settings at about 325 to 355 FPS at 1080! Haven't tested Armored Core 6 yet but reviews say that Steam loves this card and the visuals are beautiful and smooth at the initial install settings. The Firestorm card management software that you download from Zotac's website is excellent and allows you manage the graphics card overclock rate, individual fan speeds, memory overclock rates, etc. A great utility to ensure that your video card is staying cool and it has custom configurations to allow you to define your own set points. It also displays the GPU and memory temperatures so you can watch your temps change when you reconfigure the fans settings. This card I know isn't as fast as the new 40 series graphics cards are but unless you intend to play the newest games on ultra high settings and have a monitor that can support those settings as well, this card is definitely a great value for the average player and the performance will surprise you unless you are looking to spend $800 up to $1500 on a video card just so you can have bragging rights with your friends!! A $349.99 price is definitely reasonable for me, where $800 to a $1000 is not! Also if you are OK with a longer delivery wait the MSI 3060 card is pretty much the exact same card with a bit slower GPU clock timing but at about a $60 cheaper price. To be honest, I don't think you will see any difference in the 5 to 8 frames a seconds difference between the 2 cards when the difference is in the 80 FPS area anyway. Either way, I definitely think this card is a winner for the price and performance!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Upgrade from 1660 Ti... not a big deal.
reviews.reviewText: For the price, if youre building a PC, this GPU is great. Will run pretty much any games and software with good performance.But if youre upgrading, it may not be worth it.I upgraded from a 1660 Ti and really only see about a 10% improvement in performance.Its better than what I had, but still not where I want to be.But, its a good GPU, quality product, quiet, and works great! Reliable purchase

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Card for the Money
reviews.reviewText: The Zotac 3060 is a great card relative to the current price. and even supports Resizable Bar. At 1920x 1080 it does a great job handling most games and runs cool and quiet. Worth noting too the card is a reasonable size and should fit in most bases.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I recently got rid of my 1660 Super for this graphics card instead. It was effortless to install. It performs great in whatever game I play (notably: Call of Duty Warzone, Overwatch, and 7 Days). The fans are surprisingly quiet and the minimalist design was perfect for me. The only downside, which I figured would probably be needed anyway, was that my 75 hz monitor was not at the same level as the graphics card, so I purchased a 165 hz monitor to avoid screen tearing. But after that, it's been smooth sailing. Overall this graphics card has been the best PC investment I've made so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars bought on sale at $299
reviews.reviewText: the card works well, i can run most games at ultra quality other than some of the newer games that have released on the last year and a half. but i can still run them at higher qualities and they still look amazing. the only game I've had trouble running is Ark Survival Ascended but that's because it isn't optimized well and has nothing to do with the card. The only problem I've had with it is the fans are kind of loud and sound like a high pitched whistle when running games like Sons of the Forest and The Last of Us part 1. I still think the card is worth the money i paid for it, but the fans noise is the only reason I'm not giving it a 5/5.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very capable and powerful GPU for modern games. No it's not the top of the line but it's plenty and then some for 1080 gaming. I bought this card while waiting on a warranty of the card that arrived dead on arrival in my prebuilt cyberpowerPC. Got fed up with the amount of time the warranty process was taking and bought this card. The other eventually came but this one hasn't left my system and the other hasn't left it's shipment box. Highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Card, decent value
reviews.reviewText: A bit expensive, but the performance is great, I upgraded from a 1660 and the performance is like night and day, I didn't expect much out of the Ray Tracing performance going in, but it runs quite well paired with DLSS, this card at 90-100% usage never seems to go over 70c for me (your mileage may vary depending on your own case airflow), and the noise is practically nonexistent.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good card for 1440p gaming
reviews.reviewText: This is a good card for 1440p gaming at 60+ fps for most games I played. I don't have a 4K monitor so this is the best card for me without breaking a bank. The 12G of ram also beat out its 4060 successor.This is also good budget card for machine learning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Creating IA photo on local pc
reviews.reviewText: Its work very good for 1080p 144 fps ultra but if you go on 2k (1440p) you have to go higher than this (like 3070 and above) or sacrifice few setting from ultra.For creating IA photo, movie, and stuff, this is a monster. If you step inside the IA creation of model, voice, photo, movie anything you can imagine.. it work.If you just gaming you better check the 4060 (if not huge price difference) but if you go inside IA creation this is the good one the 12gb memory are very important.its good budget gpu for gaming + IA creation and train.
exelente produto entrega foi rapida e antes do prazo funcionou perfeitamente fiquei muito contente com a compra.
La grafica mejor valorada del mercado y a un mejor su precio. Es lo que necesitan para un rendimiento profecional y graficas potentes sin llegar a ultra en muchos de los casos.
Good graphics card it’s best with 12gb vram
Ottimo prodotto, resistente, molto bello, conasiglio vivamente!
